marvel.name: Hulk
marvel.description: Caught in a gamma bomb explosion while trying to save the life of a teenager, Dr. Bruce Banner was transformed into the incredibly powerful creature called the Hulk. An all too often misunderstood hero, the angrier the Hulk gets, the stronger the Hulk gets.

marvel.name: Wolverine
marvel.description: Born with super-human senses and the power to heal from almost any wound, Wolverine was captured by a secret Canadian organization and given an unbreakable skeleton and claws. Treated like an animal, it took years for him to control himself. Now, he's a premiere member of both the X-Men and the Avengers.

marvel.name: Captain America
marvel.description: Vowing to serve his country any way he could, young Steve Rogers took the super soldier serum to become America's one-man army. Fighting for the red, white and blue for over 60 years, Captain America is the living, breathing symbol of freedom and liberty.

marvel.name: Cable
marvel.description: Mutant from the future, the child of Cyclops and Jean Grey from an alternative future

marvel.name: Storm
marvel.description: Ororo Monroe is the descendant of an ancient line of African priestesses, all of whom have white hair, blue eyes, and the potential to wield magic.

marvel.name: Punisher
marvel.description: Frank Castle, a vigilante who punishes those who prey on the weak

marvel.name: Thing
marvel.description: The radiation that mutated Reed Richards, Sue Storm and Johnny Storm into superhuman beings had also mutated Ben Grimm, transforming him into a grotesque, rock-hided strongman dubbed the Thing.

marvel.name: Deadpool
marvel.description: Mutant with a twisted sense of humor

marvel.name: Phoenix
marvel.description: Also known as Jean Grey, a talented and near godlike mutant
